A Short Introduction to the blorr Package
text: event deciding cut-point probability scores logistic regression model, confusion matrix created corresponding particular cut-. observations probability scores cut-score predicted events cut-score, non-events. confusion matrix, 2X2 table, calculates number correctly classified miss-classified observations. validity cut-measured using sensitivity, specificity accuracy. Sensitivity: % correctly classified events events = TP / (TP + FN) Specificity: % correctly classified non-events non-events = TN / (TN + FP) Accuracy: % correctly classified observation observations = (TP + TN) / (TP + FP + TN + FN) True Positive (TP) : Events correctly classified events. True Negative (TN) : Non-Events correctly classified non-events. False Positive (FP): Non-events miss-classified events. False Negative (FN): Events miss-classified non-events. standard logistic model, higher cut-, lower sensitivity higher specificity. cut-decreased, sensitivity go , events captured. Also, specificity go , non-events miss-classified events. Hence trade-done based requirements. example, looking capture many events possible, can afford miss-classified non-events, low cut-taken.
code: blr_confusion_matrix(model, cutoff = 0.5) #> Confusion Matrix and Statistics  #>  #>           Reference #> Prediction    0    1 #>          0 3920  352 #>          1   84  165 #>  #>  #>                 Accuracy : 0.9036  #>      No Information Rate : 0.8856  #>  #>                    Kappa : 0.3851  #>  #> McNemars's Test P-Value  : 0.0000  #>  #>              Sensitivity : 0.3191  #>              Specificity : 0.9790  #>           Pos Pred Value : 0.6627  #>           Neg Pred Value : 0.9176  #>               Prevalence : 0.1144  #>           Detection Rate : 0.0365  #>     Detection Prevalence : 0.0551  #>        Balanced Accuracy : 0.6491  #>                Precision : 0.6627  #>                   Recall : 0.3191  #>  #>         'Positive' Class : 1

Lower values Goodness--fit preferred.

title: Collinearity diagnostics — blr_coll_diag
text: Collinearity implies two variables near perfect linear combinations one another. Multicollinearity involves two variables. presence multicollinearity, regression estimates unstable high standard errors. Tolerance Percent variance predictor accounted predictors. Variance Inflation Factor Variance inflation factors measure inflation variances parameter estimates due collinearities exist among predictors. measure much variance estimated regression coefficient \(\beta_k\)  inflated existence correlation among predictor variables model. VIF 1 means correlation among kth predictor remaining predictor variables, hence variance \(\beta_k\) inflated . general rule thumb VIFs exceeding 4 warrant investigation, VIFs exceeding 10 signs serious multicollinearity requiring correction. Condition Index multivariate statistical approaches involve decomposing correlation matrix linear combinations variables. linear combinations chosen first combination largest possible variance (subject restrictions), second combination next largest variance, subject uncorrelated first, third largest possible variance, subject uncorrelated first second, forth. variance linear combinations called eigenvalue. Collinearity spotted finding 2 variables large proportions variance (.50 ) correspond large condition indices. rule thumb label large condition indices range 30 larger.

title: Collinearity diagnostics — blr_coll_diag
text: Belsley, D. ., Kuh, E., Welsch, R. E. (1980). Regression Diagnostics: Identifying Influential Data Sources Collinearity. New York: John Wiley & Sons.
